title: Lubbock man indicted, charged in shooting that injured 10-year-old boy
content:
LUBBOCK, TX (KCBD) -
A Lubbock County grand jury indicted Kenneth Davis for aggravated assault with bodily injury with a deadly weapon on Tuesday, after a July shooting that injured three people, including a 10 year old boy.
Police say that it started as a civil disturbance on July 16 in the 2100 block of East 30th Street.
82-year-old Johnnie Taylor confronted a group of children who were playing in front of his house. Police say there was a brief physical altercation, but the children left. Then about eight adults came over and confronted Taylor.
That's when an argument started.
Police say Davis then pulled a gun and shot Taylor. Taylor then drew his own gun and returned fire.
In all, three people were struck, including Johnnie Taylor, 44-year old Cary Taylor and a 10-year-old boy.
They were all taken to the hospital with serious, but non life-threatening injuries.
Davis fled from the scene, but police found him hiding at a nearby residence and where they took him into custody.
